docs.snippet: LEAD:  Auto Racing  Allison Takes the Firecracker: Bobby Allison overcame an early brush that knocked him off the pace, charged into the lead with two laps left and beat Buddy Baker amid a crashing finish to the Firecracker 400 yesterday at Daytona...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Auto Racing Allison Takes the Firecracker: Bobby Allison overcame an early brush that knocked him off the pace, charged into the lead with two laps left and beat Buddy Baker amid a crashing finish to the Firecracker 400 yesterday at Daytona International Speedway. As Allison's Buick crossed the finish line 1.5 seconds ahead of Baker's Oldsmobile in the 160-lap race, Ken Schrader and Harry Gant, both of whom were running with the leaders, crashed hard.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Administration will announce on Monday that it intends to seek agreements by the end of President Reagan's term to phase out farm export subsidies and trade barriers to the agricultural products of the United States and other nations,...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Administration will announce on Monday that it intends to seek agreements by the end of President Reagan's term to phase out farm export subsidies and trade barriers to the agricultural products of the United States and other nations, officials said today.

headline.main: FREER FARM TRADE BY THE END OF '88 SET AS REAGAN AIM

byline.original: By PETER T. KILBORN, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: Panama and Haiti have abruptly become the most visible battlegrounds in a hemisphere-wide struggle between civilian democrats and military leaders who defy accountability. The ''untouchable'' in Panama is Gen. Manuel Noriega, who rules through...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Panama and Haiti have abruptly become the most visible battlegrounds in a hemisphere-wide struggle between civilian democrats and military leaders who defy accountability. The ''untouchable'' in Panama is Gen. Manuel Noriega, who rules through civilian figureheads. In Haiti, the junta leader is Lieut.

docs.snippet: LEAD:  Tour de France  Van der Poel Wins a Slow Stage: Adri Van der Poel of the Netherlands yesterday won the Tour de France's 161-mile ninth stage, from Orleans to Renaze. Erich Maechler of Switzerland retained the overall lead. Many riders fell...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Tour de France Van der Poel Wins a Slow Stage: Adri Van der Poel of the Netherlands yesterday won the Tour de France's 161-mile ninth stage, from Orleans to Renaze. Erich Maechler of Switzerland retained the overall lead. Many riders fell along the narrow roads of the Mayenne region of western France, and high temperatures made the stage the slowest yet.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Laura Davies, the soft-spoken 23-year-old Englishwoman who strikes thunderbolts for drives, beat Ayako Okamoto of Japan by 2 strokes and JoAnne Carner of the United States by 3 today in an 18-hole playoff to win the 42d United States Women's...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Laura Davies, the soft-spoken 23-year-old Englishwoman who strikes thunderbolts for drives, beat Ayako Okamoto of Japan by 2 strokes and JoAnne Carner of the United States by 3 today in an 18-hole playoff to win the 42d United States Women's Open golf championship.

byline.original: By GORDON S. WHITE Jr., Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: The six-year-old pasta war between the United States and the European Community may escalate this week, as Reagan Administration trade officials come up against a self-imposed Aug. 1 negotiating deadline with no resolution in sight.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The six-year-old pasta war between the United States and the European Community may escalate this week, as Reagan Administration trade officials come up against a self-imposed Aug. 1 negotiating deadline with no resolution in sight.

headline.main: No Trade Pact on Pasta As U.S. Deadline Nears

byline.original: By SUSAN F. RASKY, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: A huge United Nations economic conference, attended by most of the world's countries, was deadlocked tonight by a dispute over steps to ease the developing-world's debt burden, now approaching $1 trillion.

headline.main: U.N. Parley Deadlocked Over Third World Debt

docs.snippet: LEAD: Carmelita Maracci, a leading American ballet teacher and noted performer, died at her home in Hollywood on July 26 after a long illness. She was 75 years old.

docs.snippet: LEAD:  Tennis  Connors Surprised at Stratton: Unseeded Greg Holmes scored the first major upset of the $315,000 Volvo International tournament in Stratton, Vt., yesterday by beating second-seeded Jimmy Connors, 7-5, 7-5, in a first-round match....
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Tennis Connors Surprised at Stratton: Unseeded Greg Holmes scored the first major upset of the $315,000 Volvo International tournament in Stratton, Vt., yesterday by beating second-seeded Jimmy Connors, 7-5, 7-5, in a first-round match. Connors saved three match points before netting a volley and giving Holmes the victory.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Six years ago followers of the Indian guru Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh purchased a remote 64,000 acre ranch near here for a new ''world commune'' in the desert.
